title: YAML Configuration in Quarkus
summary: This document guides on how to configure a Quarkus application using a YAML file (application.yaml) instead of the conventional application.properties. It covers the enabling of YAML configuration via adding the 'quarkus-config-yaml' extension or dependency, syntax examples, dealing with profile-specific configurations, resolving property conflicts in YAML, and using expressions in YAML files. It also discusses configuration property conflicts and how to use YAML for complex configurations.
